children.text:
Read input

   read(*,*) position

   ! Compute first step

   nrstSeqStartIndx = 1

   do while (getValueAtIndex(nrstSeqStartIndx * 2) < position)

      nrstSeqStartIndx = nrstSeqStartIndx * 2

   end do

   do while (getValueAtIndex(nrstSeqStartIndx +1) < = position)

      nrstSeqStartIndx = nrstSeqStartIndx +1

   end do

   startIndex = getValueAtIndex(nrstSeqStartIndx)

   first_result = (position - startIndex) +1

   ! Convert first_result to string s_first

   write(s_first, '(I0)') first_result

   s_first = adjustl(s_first)

   ! Second step: check for A and B

   if (index(s_first, 'A') >0 .and. index(s_first, 'B') >0) then

      s_second = 'Yes'

   else

      s_second = 'No'

   end if

   ! Third step: replace commas with spaces

   s_third = s_second

   do i = 1, len_trim(s_second) if (s_second(i:i) == ',') then

         s_third(i:i) = ' '

      end if

   end do

   ! Output the final result

   print *, trim(s_third)

contains

   integer*8 function getValueAtIndex(index)

      integer*8, intent(in) :: index

      getValueAtIndex = 1 + (index -1)*index

Now, handling the conversion of the first result to a string in Fortran.

In Fortran, to convert an integer to a string, we can use an internal write statement.

For example:

integer*8 :: first_result

character(len=20) :: s_first

write(s_first, '(I0)') first_result

trim the string to remove leading spaces.

Alternatively, use adjustl to left-justify.

s_first = adjustl(s_first)

Then, pass this string to the second step.

Now, the steps in code:

Program main

   implicit none

   integer*8 :: position, nrstSeqStartIndx, startIndex, first_result

   character(len=20) :: s_first, s_second, s_third

   ! Read input

   read(*,*) position

   ! Compute first step

   nrstSeqStartIndx = 1

   do while (getValueAtIndex(nrstSeqStartIndx * 2) < position)

      nrstSeqStartIndx = nrstSeqStartIndx * 2

   end do

   do while (getValueAtIndex(nrstSeqStartIndx +1) <= position)

      nrstSeqStartIndx = nrstSeqStartIndx +1

   end do

   startIndex = getValueAtIndex(nrstSeqStartIndx)

   first_result = (position - startIndex) +1

   ! Convert first_result to string s_first

   write(s_first, '(I0)') first_result

   s_first = adjustl(s_first)

   ! Second step: check for A and B

   if (index(s_first, 'A') >0 .and. index(s_first, 'B') >0) then

      s_second = 'Yes'

   else

      s_second = 'No'

   end if

   ! Third step: replace commas with spaces

   s_third = s_second

   do i = 1, len_trim(s_second)

      if (s_second(i:i) == ',') then

         s_third(i:i) = ' '

      end if

   end do

   ! Output the final result

   print *, trim(s_third)

contains

   integer*8 function getValueAtIndex(index)

      integer*8, intent(in) :: index

      getValueAtIndex = 1 + (index -1)*index /2

   end function getValueAtIndex

end program main
